title: TSMC Plans Record Capital Spending on Strong AI Demand
description: TSMC Plans Record Capital Spending on Strong AI Demand - The investment plan of up to $56 billion is underpinned by robust demand as the use of artificial intelligence models in applications and the need for AI sovereignty grows, chairman says
content:
Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. Ltd. (TSMC) plans to raise its capital spending to a record high of up to $56 billion for 2026, betting that global demand for artificial intelligence (AI) will stay strong.

title: Wikipedia inks AI deals with Microsoft, Meta
description: wikipedia unveiled new business deals with a slew of artificial intelligence companies on thursday as it marked its 25th anniversary. the online crowdsourced encyclopedia revealed that it has signed up ai companies including amazon, meta platforms, perplexity, microsoft and france’s mistral ai. wikipedia is one of the last bastions of the early internet, but that original vision of a free online space has been clouded by the dominance of big tech platforms and the rise of generative ai chatbots trained on c

title: China just 'months' behind U.S. AI models, Google DeepMind CEO says
description: China's artificial intelligence models may be just "months" behind U.S. and Western capabilities, Demis Hassabis, the CEO of Google DeepMind told CNBC.

title: Publishers seek to join lawsuit against Google over AI training
description: Jan 15 (Reuters) - Publishers ‌Hachette Book Group and Cengage Group asked a California federal court ‌on Thursday for permission to intervene in a proposed class action ‌lawsuit against Google over the alleged misuse of copyrighted material used to train its artificial intelligence systems.

title: State, federal lawmakers want data centers to pay more for energy
description: A growing body of research suggests that the rapid growth of data centers to support the development of artificial intelligence is beginning to drive up electricity costs for residents and small businesses in some places.

title: Senate Rejects Budget Cuts, Boosts Science Funding
description: The U.S. Senate has passed a bill approving billions in funding for federal science agencies, countering proposed budget cuts by the White House. Major beneficiaries include NASA, NSF, and NOAA, with NSF receiving $8.75 billion to advance quantum information science and artificial intelligence research, while NOAA receives $634 million for weather forecasting improvements.
content:
WASHINGTON, Jan 15 - In a decisive move, the U.S. Senate has voted in favor of a bill allocating billions of dollars to federal science agencies, effectively overturning the significant budget cuts proposed by the White House.
